criterion: Reward for accurately documenting all patient-reported information from the encounter, including mood improvement uncertainty, initial nausea, inconsistent timing/with-food intake of sertraline, skipped refill due to cost, and daily routine challenges.

Reward for accurately documenting clinician statements and actions, such as reassurance about transient nausea, advice to take sertraline with food and set a phone reminder, and intent to pursue affordability/assistance programs.

Reward for correctly incorporating only relevant chart information (patient age/sex, active diagnoses of major depressive disorder and anxiety, current sertraline 50 mg) without adding unrelated chart items.
Penalize for omission or incomplete capture of any major statement, symptom, side effect, adherence issue, or plan element present in the transcript (overall completeness).

Penalize for inclusion of fabricated or inferred content not supported by the transcript or chart—e.g., new diagnoses, physical exam findings, lab orders, dosage changes, additional symptoms, or follow-up plans.
Penalize for inaccurate or indiscriminate copying from the chart, such as incorrect medication details, erroneous conditions, or inclusion of chart data not pertinent to this visit.
